p: In our work, 1,8-cineole was the main detected component in the liquid (30.4%) and vapor (48.4%) phase of S. officinalis EO and HY (61.4%). S. officinalis EOs collected from north of Tunisia, Hatay (Turkey) and Albania showed 1,8-cineole (33.27%, 60.72% and 26.9%, respectively) as the main component [ 36, 37, 38]. On the contrary, Baydar et al. [ 39] reported α-thujone (20.06%) and camphor (43.38%) as the major compounds of EO and HY, respectively, in plants from Isparta, Turkey. α-Thujone was also the principal constituent in EOs from Mexico and California (18.8% and 27.4%) [ 38], while in two Italian sites eucalyptol (from 40.22% to 60.94%) was the chemical compound characterizing the related wild Salvia fruticosa subsp. thomasii [ 22].
